description: The program simply fails to load anything past the first menu of options.
It crashes on the first menu

The program doesn't show up anywhere after "installing".

I then went to my Terminal and did a "sudo apt install aldo", where it would install, and did a little exploring of the non-GUI progran, and it had several bugs and was altogether hardly useful, so I removed that as well.
summary: Really doesn't install properly on Ubuntu 20.04

description: Type aldo from the command prompt and works fine.

~$ aldo
Aldo 0.7.7 Main Menu
	1: Blocks method
	2: Koch method
	3: Read from file
	4: Callsigns
	5: Setup
	6: Exit
Your choice: 2

Keying speed: 20 wpm
About to start keying. Get ready...
Letters in lesson: k m r s u a p t l o w i . n j e f 0 y , v g 5 / q 9 z h 3 8 b ? 4 2 7 c 1 d 6 x 
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'libaudiostream::AudioException'
 what(): std::exception
Aborted (core dumped)
~$

Installed with sudo apt install aldo.
Run in a console window. 
---
serge@lenovo:~$ aldo 
Aldo 0.7.7 Main Menu
    1: Blocks method
    2: Koch method
    3: Read from file
    4: Callsigns
    5: Setup
    6: Exit
Your choice: 
---
Works.
summary: aldo - A fully console morse code trainer written in ISO C++
